title: Catalan Numbers - Part 1
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: We posed a question in the beginning of  this chapter and told you that we'll be
covering it at the end of the chapter.  Here we present the concept of Catalan
numbers. This concept appears  in many works of computing.
Remember this problem that we started  off in the beginning of this chapter;
in how many ways can one start from (0,0) and then  reach (5,5) without crossing the diagonal. Right?
This is a complicated problem and it involves some  different method that we have not seen so far.
Let's see how to solve this problem now. Let me ask you a puzzle here. If I start
from this point (0,0) and if I have to reach  this point (5,5) in how many ways can I reach
there? What are the total number of paths  that I can take from (0,0) to reach (5,5)?
What I mean here is this is one path to reach  (5,5). This is another path to reach (5,5). So
the question is in how many ways can I reach  (5,5) if I start from (0,0). Think about it.
Please try solving this problem.  The professor is now going to give
a constrained version of the same  problem. Let us see the problem now.
